column1: Nonpayment of rent - Georgia landlords can provide a Notice to Pay to a non-paying tenant. If the tenant cannot pay within the next day, the landlord can start an eviction.

Violation of lease terms - Georgia landlords can request that tenants immediately remedy lease provision violations. There is no timeframe mandated by law, so Georgia landlords can start eviction proceedings immediately.
Illegal acts - Georgia landlords are entitled to evict tenants for engaging in illegal behaviors. This eviction follows normal procedures and can proceed in just 24 hours.
